intro: Struthiola hirsuta var. glabrescens, commonly known as the hairy struthiola, is a variant of the struthiola plant characterized by its reduced hairiness compared to the typical variety. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae, known for its delicate and often fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and may have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered. This variant is appreciated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
